title: Netatalk dsi_writeinit Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the dsi_writeinit function. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Netatalk has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://github.com/Netatalk/Netatalk/pull/186
timeline:
2022-06-03 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-02-06 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Corentin BAYET (@OnlyTheDuck), Etienne HELLUY-LAFONT and Luca MORO (@johncool__) from Synacktiv
